title: Dependency-Aware Task Offloading in Mimo Vehicular Networks Based on Deep Reinforcement Learning
affiliations: Shanghai University of Engineering Science and Shanghai University of Engineering Science

detail.title: Dependency-Aware Task Offloading in Mimo Vehicular Networks Based on Deep Reinforcement Learning
detail.abstract: Mobile Edge Computing (MEC) offers a promising solution to alleviate the computational burden faced by vehicles when processing resource-intensive tasks under constrained environments. However, computational tasks often exhibit interdependencies, which are largely overlooked in existing research. Even when dependencies are considered, the focus tends to remain on single-user scenarios. To address these limitations, this paper proposes a task offloading strategy for multi-vehicle, multi-server vehicular networks, aiming to maximize the overall system Quality of Service (QoS). First, a multi-vehicle MEC system model is constructed using Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (MIMO) technology. A Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) is then employed to represent the dependency relationships among tasks, where nodes and directed edges denote subtasks and their dependencies, respectively. Finally, a task scheduling method is developed by integrating a Graph Attention Network (GAT) with Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL), designed to optimize the system’s QoS. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method outperforms baseline algorithms in various performance metrics, offering an effective solution to the challenge of dependency-aware task offloading in vehicular networks.

detail.title: Al-Quran Based Digital Innovation: Integration of Surah Al-Baqarah (2:282) and Al-Mu’Taffifin (83:1–3) into ERP System for Halal Integrity
detail.abstract: Integration of 5 Quranic principles: transparency, traceability, fairness, prudence, and honesty into Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system is the foundation of accountable transactions for ensuring the halal status of products throughout its supply chain. Surah Al-Baqarah 2:282 (the importance of recording transactions) and Al-Mu’taffifin 83:1–3 (prohibition of cheating) are the two main references. Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) formalizes the five principles into ERP architecture through SysML diagrams. Block Definition Diagram links these principles: ERP Modules (transparency), blockchain (traceability), AI-based Modules (fairness), AI-based OCR/optical character recognition for Halal Authentication (prudence), and Knowledge Management System (honesty). While Internal Block-Use Case-Sequence and Activity Diagrams map the flow of products and information, interactions between actors, and authentication stages. The conceptual design shows the relevance and operationalization of the 5 Quranic principles (which were revealed 14 centuries ago) in the current modern digital system.

detail.title: The Effect of Social Media on Modern Communication
detail.abstract: The rapid rise of social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, WhatsApp, and YouTube has revolutionized communication. This study explores how these platforms influence interpersonal communication, business practices, and educational collaboration. Social media has enabled real-time information sharing, collaborative learning, and brand-customer engagement. However, issues such as privacy invasion, misinformation, and reduced face-to-face interactions present significant challenges. The purpose of this study is to critically examine the role of social media as a communication tool and its societal impact, focusing on both positive and negative aspects. A mixed-methods approach, including surveys and secondary data analysis, was employed in Guwahati city. The study highlights the transformative nature of social media in shaping communication trends and how individuals, particularly youth, are adapting. The findings offer insights into how social media platforms can be optimized for effective communication, while also identifying areas for improvement and responsible use.

title: A Cooperative Distributed Model to Evaluate and Optimize Task Offloading in Mobile Edge Computing

detail.title: A Cooperative Distributed Model to Evaluate and Optimize Task Offloading in Mobile Edge Computing
detail.abstract: In the the context of Mobile Edge Computing, user devices (UDs) aim to direct their service requests to edge servers that provide the best Quality of user Experience (QoE). At the same time, edge domains must meet their own operational constraints, such as server consolidation, which –while reducing resource usage– may degrade QoE perceived by a UD. Given the highly dynamic and distributed nature of such systems, identifying a global optimal solution that balances client- and server-side requirements remains a complex challenge. To address this, we propose an algorithm that optimizes the match between user devices and edge servers by forming adaptive clusters based on two synthetic indicators: (i) the serverside utility of accepting a service request from a particular UD, and (ii) the QoE perceived and/or measured by the UD when sending a request to a specific edge domain. Our model also incorporates cooperative behavior among UDs, who share recommendations about QoE for specific services and edge domains. These recommendations are evaluated using a trust mechanism that assesses the reliability of each UD’s feedback. The proposed algorithm exploits this information to asymptotically maximize the collective utility of edge servers and UDs, which is computed on the basis of the server side utility and the QoE. We demonstrate through theoretical results that the computed solution constitutes a Nash equilibrium and that only those agents providing reliable feedback are rewarded –thus promoting trustworthy collaboration among UDs. Experimental validation confirms the effectiveness of the proposed method.

title: Futurology in Law and Human Rights: Envisioning Digital Rights and Future-Proofing Democracy
affiliations: Newcastle University

detail.title: Futurology in Law and Human Rights: Envisioning Digital Rights and Future-Proofing Democracy
detail.abstract: This article explores how futurology methodologies can be leveraged in legal theory and international human rights law to address current and emerging challenges, with a particular focus on digital rights and democracy. Bridging abstract theory with practice, the paper surveys conceptual approaches in futures studies—including scenario planning, trend analysis, speculative design, and strategic foresight—and examines their relevance as analytical tools for law. It argues that the legal field's traditional reliance on precedent and reactive change must give way to anticipatory governance models. In the human rights context, the article highlights a gap in forward-looking scholarship: while historical analyses of rights abound, engagements with the futures of human rights remain nascent. The core of the paper applies futures methodology to digital-era issues, illustrating how techniques like horizon scanning and participatory scenario-building can illuminate the trajectory of phenomena such as mass surveillance, algorithmic bias, and the impact of social media on democracy. Building on these insights, the article proposes a concrete futurology-based methodology for international human rights, intended to "future-proof" human rights—ensuring that legal protections remain robust amid fast-changing digital landscapes and beyond.

detail.abstract: China has become a top destination for international students, prompting concerns about whether its universities meet their academic expectations. This study examines the learning experiences of international students, drawing on Berry's Acculturation Theory and Self-Determination Theory. It examines how scholarship satisfaction mediates the effects of financial stress, institutional support, and cultural adjustment on learning outcomes. Data from 845 international students in Shaanxi, China, were analyzed using SEM and LSTM techniques. Findings indicate that cultural adjustment and institutional support improve scholarship satisfaction, enhancing academic success. Conversely, financial stress negatively impacts both scholarship satisfaction and learning outcomes. The study also reveals a complex relationship between academic performance and workload-balanced workloads boost satisfaction, while excessive workloads reduce performance. The research contributes theoretically by validating scholarship satisfaction as a mediator and reinforcing institutional support theories. These insights can help Chinese universities enhance international students' academic experiences through better financial aid, cultural integration, and workload management.

detail.abstract: This paper explores three machine learning models for weather prediction namely Support Vector Machine (SVM), Artificial Neural Network (ANN) and a Time Series based Recurrent Neural Network (RNN). It also discusses the steps followed to achieve results. RNN using time series along with a linear SVC and a five-layered neural network is used to predict the weather. The results of these models are analyzed and compared on the basis of Root Mean Squared Error between the predicted and actual values. For weather forecasting, this paper uses Pandas, NumPy, Keras, Git, Matplotlib, TensorFlow, Anaconda, and Google Cloud Services [4]. It is found that Time Series based RNN does the best job of predicting the weather, consistent with the findings of Rasp, Pritchard, and Gentine [1], who demonstrated the effectiveness of deep learning models for climate and atmospheric forecasting.

detail.title: Secure Communications Design and Centralized Operations Management Processes for Microreactors
detail.abstract: Microreactors are ideal for isolated communities, mining operations, military bases, or disaster response. A key feature for microreactor deployment is remote operations capability from a centralized control center. While centralized control of geographically dispersed assets is a common practice in many industries including telecommunications, electric utilities, and power generation; it is an emerging concept for the nuclear industry. Remote operations can enhance microreactors’ economic feasibility; however, it can increase cybersecurity risks, necessitating a secure communications architecture to protect against potential attacks. This paper presents a functional design for secure communication between the centralized control center and a fleet of microreactors using currently available technology. Since microreactors are designed to be safe by default, this paper focuses on how to implement secure communication between the control systems and microreactors as an operational goal. It also highlights best practices used by other critical infrastructure sectors at their control centers.

detail.title: An Empirical Study of the Evolution of Github Actions Workflows
detail.abstract: CI/CD practices play a significant role during collaborative software development by automating time-consuming and repetitive tasks such as testing, building, quality checking, dependency and security management. GitHub Actions, the CI/CD tool integrated into GitHub, allows repository maintainers to automate development workflows. We conducted a mixed methods analysis of GitHub Actions workflow changes over time. Through a qualitative analysis of 439 modified workflow files we identified seven types of conceptual changes to workflows. Next, we performed a quantitative analysis over 31K+ GitHub repositories totaling 131K+ workflow change histories and 1.1M+ workflow file versions from November 2019 to October 2023. This analysis revealed that repositories contain a median of two workflow files, and 8.4% of all workflow files are being changed every week. The changes made to workflows tend to be small, with about three-quarters containing only a single change. The large majority of the observed changes have to do with task configuration and task specification in workflow jobs. Our findings highlight the need for improved tooling to support fine-grained maintenance tasks in change-prone areas such as run, uses, and permissions. Our analysis also underscores the potential of increased automation, such as broader adoption of dependency update tools to keep reusable Actions up to date. Finally, we identify a need for better debugging and validation support.

title: A Lightweight Dual-Server Aggregation Federated Learning Framework with Malicious Client Identification

detail.title: A Lightweight Dual-Server Aggregation Federated Learning Framework with Malicious Client Identification
detail.abstract: Federated learning (FL) can effectively integrate data from different sources for model training, and its core advantage is that the data is always retained locally during the training and inference process, thus effectively ensuring data privacy and security. However, existing federated learning methods still face two critical challenges: (1) the reliance on complex cryptographic techniques for secure data communication substantially increases computational and communication overhead; and (2) ensuring robustness against Byzantine attacks while preserving data privacy remains inherently difficult. To address these challenges, this paper proposes FedLS (Lightweight Secure Federated Learning Scheme), a novel federated learning framework that simultaneously ensures privacy preservation and Byzantine robustness while maintaining computational efficiency. Specifically, a new secure server is added to form a dual-server model, where malicious clients are accurately rejected by comparing the directional consistency and distance of model parameters of model parameters before model aggregation, and a secret sharing technique is used to split the model parameters into two parts and upload them to two servers respectively, so as to realize the secure aggregation of the models without disclosing individual model parameters. Experiments were conducted on MNIST and CIFAR datasets, verifying that the classification and recognition accuracy of models trained based on the FedLS framework is improved by 15\% compared to LSFL, and the training time efficiency is improved by nearly 50\%, which effectively improves the training efficiency of the models under the joint learning framework. In addition, it is also verified that FedLS is able to recognize noise, symbol flipping and its variant attacks with an accuracy of up to 100\% and a false recognition rate of 0\%, which is better than LSFL as well as Bulyan.

detail.title: A Framework to Control Web Access by Adaptive Blocking, Time Based Restriction, and Oversight Monitored Exception Processing
detail.abstract: This proposal presents an intelligent system for regulating website access through dynamically constructed time based restrictions and an adaptive blocking mechanism. Unlike fixed black lists that totally prohibit certain websites, the system in place gives an administrative body the power to block access to certain websites at certain periods. In the modern architectural systems purposeful monitoring of user activity is a central feature, and the repeated attempts to enter a blocked site receive successively enhanced waiting time in order to strengthen overarching security and work-rate policies. One of the unique features found in this architecture is the controlled requesting option where users can request temporary access when they have to access the locked sites. The requests of the Internet access are filtered and approved by e-mail messages or the administrative dashboard of the system. The system does not allow exceptions to be given in anything short of a highly disciplined system. The platform has a well-designed logging and monitoring systems that keep tracks of all user activities, and provide organizations and users with extensive information on how the internet is being utilised. This service enhances the observation of security, policy observance, and online responsibility. Targeted toward corporate environments, educational institutions, and parental control applications, the system advances productivity, strengthens cybersecurity, and promotes disciplined internet engagement. By integrating intelligent scheduling, adaptive blocking, and secure access management, this invention offers a modern and effective approach to internet stewardship.

detail.title: A Proposed Incident Response Framework for Data Breach Resilience in Smart City Databases
detail.abstract: Securing the underlying databases may constitute one of the most significant challenges of smart city deployments. This study aims to address the growing need for curbing issues of data breach in smart city technologies and the maintenance of data breach resilience in smart city databases. Using a desk research methodology, the need for implementation of the IRF for data breach resilience in smart city databases was comprehensively investigated. Findings revealed that there appeared to be a deliberate emphasis on the seamless interoperability of SC components, enabling technologies in SC architectures, synergy of operations between humans and machines rather than the security of the underlying databases. The study recommends that Smart city developers must look for ways to incorporate an incident response framework (IRF) into smart city component databases platforms to handle the heterogeneous nature of SC data and enhance data breach resilience.

title: Categorical and Opinion-Based Trust Assessments for Verifiable Credential Assurance
affiliations: affiliation not provided to SSRN, University of Trento, affiliation not provided to SSRN, affiliation not provided to SSRN, affiliation not provided to SSRN and affiliation not provided to SSRN

detail.title: Categorical and Opinion-Based Trust Assessments for Verifiable Credential Assurance
detail.abstract: The growing shift from centralized to decentralized identity management has introduced new opportunities for privacy, user control, and data protection. However, one of the key challenges in decentralized systems is the lack of a reliable mechanism to assess the trustworthiness of digital credentials issued by independent trust anchors. This paper proposes a hybrid trust assessment model that combines static claim-level scoring with dynamic behavioral trust derived from distributed network opinions. Instead of binary outcomes, the model introduces multi-level assurance tiers and dynamically adapts to context and user behavior. The model integrates Subjective Logic-based trust networks with continuous policy evaluation, which enables verifiers to make fine-grained, real-time trust decisions without centralized authorities. Furthermore, we introduce a temporal trust decay function that continuously reduces credential assurance over time, effectively closing the window for replayed or stolen credentials and aligning with zero‑trust principles. The model is implemented using a continuous policy evaluation framework and a behavioral trust engine. This work provides a scalable, interoperable foundation for trust in decentralized ecosystems and advances SSI adoption beyond issuer-centric approaches.

detail.abstract: This study aims to analyze the influence of leadership in student organizations on the motivation and performance of its members, and to test the mediating role of motivation in this relationship. The background of this study is based on the importance of the role of student organizations as a forum for the formation of leadership character and human resource development at the university level. The approach used in this study is a quantitative approach with a survey method, where data were collected by distributing questionnaires to 120 active respondents in student organizations. Data analysis was carried out using multiple regression, Sobel mediation test, and Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) to test the relationship between variables as a whole. The results of the study indicate that leadership has a positive and significant effect on the motivation and performance of organizational members. Motivation also has a significant effect on performance, and is statistically proven to mediate the effect of leadership on performance. The SEM model used shows good construct validity and reliability, as well as strong support for the relationship between variables. These findings support the theory of transformational leadership and the theory of expectancy motivation, which states that leaders who are able to inspire and empower their members can increase work enthusiasm and individual productivity in the organization. This study suggests that student organizations and mentoring institutions develop leadership programs that are oriented towards increasing motivation and performance, as well as creating a collaborative and inspiring organizational environment. This study also opens up space for the development of further studies with a broader scope and a mixed-method approach.

detail.title: Predicting Answer Quality in Knowledge Community: A Theory-Driven Trusted Multi-View Learning Model
detail.abstract: Many companies have built product knowledge communities that allow customers and employees to interact about providing product-related knowledge and collecting ideas for potential new products and services. Current research on knowledge communities has primarily focused on exploring influential factors for predicting answer quality, neglecting a thorough examination of the deep semantic alignment between questions and answers. To address this gap, we propose a theory-driven trusted multi-view learning (TDTM) model based on the knowledge quality model (KAM) theory to improve answer quality in knowledge communities. Specifically, argument quality, source credibility and information usefulness features are learned from texts and respondents' characteristics. A respondent-guided matching module is designed to capture dynamic interaction between questions and answers. A trusted multi-view fusion approach is developed to effectively reduce uncertainty in multi-view information and thus improve prediction reliability. The proposed model is validated on a real-world dataset comprising 14,126 question-answer pairs collected from Autohome.com, a large-scale product knowledge community in China. The experimental results demonstrate that the TDTM method outperforms state-of-the-art methods in both accuracy and explainability. Compared to the best-performing baseline model, TDTM achieves improvements of 5.73% in F1-score and 5.08% in AUC, respectively.

detail.title: The Effect of the End of Hiring Incentives on Job and Employment Security

publicationDetails.journalName: IZA Institute of Labor Economics Discussion Paper Series

detail.abstract: We analyse the long-term impact of hiring subsidies on both job and employment security. The subsidy that we examine was introduced in Italy through the 2015 Budget Law, with the goal of promoting open-ended contracts. We employ a non-linear difference-in-differences (NL-DiD) approach within a duration framework, using high-frequency, population-wide linked employer-employee administrative data from a large Italian region. Causal results on job security indicate that the subsidys protective effect is short-lived. Excess separations from subsidised jobs peak in the exact same month in which the monetary incentive expires. No long-term protective effect of the subsidy is observed regarding employment security. These results hold across a wide range of worker and firm characteristics, showing surprisingly little heterogeneity. One notable exception concerns firm size. Furthermore, the expiration of subsidies disproportionately affects workers with low human capital.Our findings suggest that hiring subsidies are not effective in promoting either job or employment security for beneficiaries and that this raises questions about the efficacy of this common and costly policy, particularly when offered unconditionally.

detail.title: Solving Mixed Strategy Equilibrium Using Machine Learning: Evidence from Stock Exchange Fees
detail.abstract: Stock exchanges compete for order flow by setting "make" fees for limit orders and "take" fees for market orders. No pure-strategy Nash equilibrium exists in this two-dimensional fee competition, as adjusting the (make, take) fee structure attracts different segments of the market. We provide the first solution for the mixed-strategy equilibrium using neural networks. Our results show that competition improves overall market functioning by increasing transaction volume. However, one side of the market captures most of the gains. Our method can also be applied to other two-dimensional competitive settings, such as games in which both price and quality vary continuously.

title: Corporate Social Responsibility and its Effects on the Links between Innovation, Sustainability, and Profitability Effectiveness: Insights from Semiconductor Firms

detail.title: Corporate Social Responsibility and its Effects on the Links between Innovation, Sustainability, and Profitability Effectiveness: Insights from Semiconductor Firms
detail.abstract: The semiconductor industry plays a critical role in advancing technology, yet its growth presents complex challenges in balancing performance and sustainability, making comprehensive evaluation essential. This study employs the Dynamic Network Slack-Based Measure to evaluate business performance across three keys of effectiveness: innovation (IE), sustainability (SE), and profitability (PE) among 50 global semiconductor firms from 2017 to 2022. Furthermore, hierarchical regression analyses are conducted to examine the relationship between three effectiveness metrics, along with investigating the influence of CSR factors driven by ESG components: Environmental, Social, Governance, and overall ESG on the IE-SE and SE-PE relationships. The study reveals (1) the negative impact of SE on PE might result in SE weaken the indirect effect of IE on PE, while IE has a significantly positive direct effect on both SE and PE. (2) Both Environmental and overall ESG factors strengthen the significantly positive IE-SE relationship, though their impact on the SE-PE relationship is insignificant. These insights underscore the nuanced moderating role of CSR practices in promoting both innovation and sustainability, suggesting that firms should adopt a long-term orientation and appropriate strategies aimed at enhancing competitiveness while supporting responsible business practices to create sustainable profits.

detail.title: Identifying Key Parameters to Design Sustainable Projects
detail.abstract: Due to social, environmental and technical evolutions, we need to change our manner to design and manage the design of our systems. Traditional project management practices need to evolve in order to account for the integration of new sustainability objectives. However, there is a gap in the literature concerning the parameters for a successful management of sustainability-oriented design projects. The proposed paper aims at identifying these key parameters. The research methodology is a literature analysis to cross 1) the specificities and characteristics of the management of traditional design projects and 2) the specificities and characteristics of sustainability and sustainability-oriented design projects. The intersection of these two domains allows highlighting a list of key parameters. Finally, they are confronted with and for the practitioners through semi-structured interviews. These tests demonstrate the interest for these parameters and a need to go forward to position each project according to these parameters.

title: A Human Rights Funding Tragedy Foretold - James Ron

detail.title: A Human Rights Funding Tragedy Foretold - James Ron

declarations.ethicsApproval: This is a review of past articles I have written. No consent is required.

detail.abstract: The new US administration has sharply revised its foreign aid portfolio, and many European donors are following suit. As a result, the overseas development assistance sector is undergoing a substantial contraction. Some of the hardest-hit groups will be those working on human rights, women's rights, and democracy. Among these are many faith-based civil society groups, which now face financial challenges. Yet, these groups also have the resources to address these challenges, including high levels of trust among their co-citizens. About 10 years ago, my colleagues and I began worrying about the global human rights community's increasingly heavy reliance on funds from Western governments. Although this international enthusiasm for human rights work was encouraging, it was also creating a set of tacit incentives that were skewing NGO funding models, particularly in low and middleincome countries. Now, those economic chickens have come home to roost.

detail.title: Gender Differences in Willingness to Guess Revisited: Heterogeneity in a High Stakes Professional Setting
detail.abstract: Multiple choice question tests are often the gateway to important professional outcomes. We study gender differences in willingness to guess among highly skilled and trained candidates who take a high stakes multiple choice question test, before and after a reduction in the number of alternative answers to each question, lowering the penalty for incorrect answers to the critical value, i.e, the one yielding zero expected value upon uniform beliefs. We find heterogeneous gender differences, replicate the previous finding that women answer fewer questions than men, and conclude that reducing the number of alternative answers levels the field for men and women among those candidates who answer most of the questions.

title: Classifying Mixed-Defect from Single-Defect Training in Imbalanced Wafer Maps Via Diffusion and Attention
affiliations: Yonsei University, The Catholic University of Korea and Yonsei University

detail.title: Classifying Mixed-Defect from Single-Defect Training in Imbalanced Wafer Maps Via Diffusion and Attention
detail.abstract: Accurate wafer bin map (WBM) classification in semiconductor manufacturing is crucial for identifying the root causes of defects and improving production efficiency. As process complexity increases, mixed-defect instances become more frequent in WBMs, highlighting the need for robust classification methods that can identify multiple defect origins. However, in real-world scenarios, single-defect WBMs are often class imbalanced, and mixed-defect WBMs lack labels due to high annotation costs, making classification particularly challenging. Therefore, we propose the first method that is capable of robustly classifying both single- and mixed-defect WBMs using only class-imbalanced single-defect training data. Our approach leverages a generalized zero-shot learning framework that classifies both seen and unseen classes by exploiting semantic information and employs a diffusion model as a generative classifier. The proposed method consists of two key components. First, a class-mixing diffusion model is designed to enhance the generation quality of underrepresented mixed and tail classes by learning from potential class combinations. Second, the classification performance achieved for seen classes is improved by using the prompt-wise attention score similarity to compare the generation processes for the training and test samples. Experiments conducted on the MixedWM38 dataset, which is commonly used in WBM classification research, demonstrate that our method achieves superior generalization performance with less overfitting to the training data and realizes significantly improved classification accuracy owing to its enhanced generation quality.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于广义零样本学习和扩散模型的方法，用于在半导体制造中准确分类单缺陷和混合缺陷的晶圆图（WBM），解决了数据不平衡和标注缺失的挑战。
AI.research_question: 如何在数据不平衡且混合缺陷缺乏标注的情况下，实现对单缺陷和混合缺陷晶圆图的鲁棒分类？
AI.motivation: 随着半导体制造工艺复杂度的增加，混合缺陷实例增多，但单缺陷数据不平衡且混合缺陷缺乏标注，传统分类方法难以应对。

AI.method: 1. 设计类混合扩散模型以增强对少数类和混合类的生成质量；2. 利用提示注意力分数相似性提升分类性能。

title: Sustainable Airline Operations: A Season-Based Optimization Framework for Flight Scheduling and Aircraft Assignment
affiliations: Xiamen University and Xiamen University

detail.title: Sustainable Airline Operations: A Season-Based Optimization Framework for Flight Scheduling and Aircraft Assignment
detail.abstract: Global air transport networks face significant challenges in optimizing flight scheduling and aircraft assignment due to network complexity and market volatility. This study addresses the critical problem of sustainable flight schedule optimization and aircraft allocation. Taking the carbon emissions into account, we construct a dual-objective optimization model aiming to maximize operational profits and minimize carbon emissions. The model scale is reduced through time segmentation and variable optimization strategies. A spatio-temporal non-dominated sorting genetic algorithm (ST-NSGA) is developed to solve the proposed model. Numerical studies validate the effectiveness of our approach, where the optimization algorithm shows competitive performance with only 2.76% gap compared to Gurobi, while effectively handling large-scale problems, and comparative studies reveal that our multi-objective optimization strategy reduces carbon emissions by 11.26% while maintaining profitability. It demonstrates that the proposed model and approach significantly reduces carbon emissions while maintaining operational profitability.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种考虑碳排放的双目标优化模型，用于可持续航班调度与飞机分配，通过时空非支配排序遗传算法（ST-NSGA）解决大规模问题，验证了模型在减少碳排放（11.26%）的同时保持盈利的有效性。
AI.research_question: 如何在复杂的全球航空运输网络中优化航班调度与飞机分配，同时兼顾运营利润与碳排放？

title: Treasure Liquidity and RMB Exchange Rates
affiliations: Renmin University of China and Renmin University of China

detail.title: Treasure Liquidity and RMB Exchange Rates
detail.abstract: This paper estimates the relative liquidity yields on government bonds between China and other major advanced and emerging economies and examine their roles on determining bilateral RMB exchange rates. We document a notable rise in China’s relative Treasury liquidity yield over time. The changes of liquidity yields are significant in explaining the movements in bilateral RMB exchange rates for both developed economies and emerging market economies. These effects are especially pronounced during periods of heightened foreign investor participation in China’s bond market, but become subdued when China was involved in significant disputes with other countries. Additionally, we find that the currency swap market friction is important determinant of China’s bond liquidity yield.

AI.tldr: 本文估计了中国与其他主要发达和新兴经济体政府债券的相对流动性收益，并探讨了其对双边人民币汇率的决定作用。研究发现，中国的国债流动性收益随时间显著上升，且流动性收益的变化对发达和新兴经济体的双边人民币汇率变动有显著解释力。这些效应在外国投资者参与中国债券市场活跃时尤为明显，但在中国与其他国家发生重大争端时减弱。此外，货币互换市场的摩擦是中国债券流动性收益的重要决定因素。
AI.research_question: 中国与其他主要经济体的政府债券相对流动性收益如何影响双边人民币汇率？
AI.motivation: 探讨流动性收益在汇率决定中的作用，尤其是在中国债券市场国际化背景下的动态变化。

title: Optimal Design and Allocation of Solar Energy for Critical Distributed Traffic Light Loads Using an Iterative Topsis Method
affiliations: Imam Khomeini International University, Murdoch University, Imam Khomeini International University, Imam Khomeini International University and Amirkabir University of Technology

detail.title: Optimal Design and Allocation of Solar Energy for Critical Distributed Traffic Light Loads Using an Iterative Topsis Method

keywords.keywords: Keywords:Solar systemCritical loads (CLs)Urban transportation systemsEnergy crisisRenewable energy sources (RESs)Traffic lights

detail.abstract: The uninterrupted operation of critical and distributed loads, such as traffic lights in urbanenvironments, during power outages presents a significant challenge for city management andinfrastructure authorities. Even brief power disruptions due to energy crises can trigger cascadingissues, including traffic congestion, delays, accidents, and delays in emergency response vehicles,such as fire trucks and ambulances. Consequently, guaranteeing a reliable supplementary powersupply for these essential loads is becoming increasingly crucial.This study offers a comparative analysis of existing power supply solutions, including traditionalgrid connections, renewable energy systems, and hybrid configurations that incorporateenergy storage technologies. A case study focusing on traffic lights at major intersections inQazvin City demonstrates the practical application and efficacy of the proposed methods inreal-world scenarios. The investigation evaluates the performance of a solar energy systemduring short-term outages, emphasizing the impact of seasonal variations in solar radiation andambient temperature. Response strategies to planned electricity interruptions are examined, withrecommendations formulated to improve system reliability for critical loads. The results indicatethat the highest operational continuity occurs during outages around 9 AM, while capacitydiminishes at night, predominantly due to the system’s dependence on battery storage. Monthlydata projections suggest operation times of approximately 4–8 h at 50% battery charge and 5–9h at 80% charge.In this optimization problem, the mutual goals of traffic and electrical performance weresimultaneously considered as a multi-objective framework. Moreover, the optimal selection ofcandidate intersections for solar system deployment was performed using the TOPSIS method inboth the conventional and iterative modes. The iterative approach, which integrates the influenceof prior selections into subsequent decision-making, yielded higher accuracy and more consistentresults. To enhance the robustness of the analysis, a sensitivity analysiswas conducted by varyingone or two parameters simultaneously within the TOPSIS framework. This process ensured thatthe results were not only reliable but also resilient to parameter fluctuations, providing a preciseand dependable foundation for strategic decision-making in critical urban-energy applications.

AI.tldr: 本文比较了传统电网、可再生能源系统和混合配置在停电时为关键负载（如交通信号灯）提供备用电源的解决方案，并通过案例研究验证了太阳能系统在短期停电中的性能。研究发现，系统在白天表现最佳，夜间依赖电池存储。通过TOPSIS方法优化了太阳能系统的部署位置，迭代模式提高了结果的准确性。

title: Flatness Control for Cold Rolling Process of Steel Strip Based on Ddpg with Delay Compensation
affiliations: Yanshan University, Yanshan University, Northeastern University, Yanshan University - State Key Laboratory of Metastable Materials Science and Technology, Yanshan University and University of Wollongong

detail.title: Flatness Control for Cold Rolling Process of Steel Strip Based on Ddpg with Delay Compensation

keywords.keywords: DDPG Algorithm  Cold Rolling Process  Flatness Control  Time-Delay compensation  Reinforcement Learning  Nonlinear Actuator Coordination

detail.abstract: Flatness control in cold rolling processes poses significant challenges due to multivariable interactions, strong coupling effects, nonlinear dynamics, and time-delay characteristics, making it a complex industrial control problem. Conventional control approaches that rely on static models with fixed parameters inherently exhibit limitations in accuracy and robustness. These limitations become particularly pronounced during unsteady-state rolling phases, including acceleration/deceleration, flying gauge control, and tension loss during shape cutting. There are significant parameter mutations at these phases. To address these challenges, this study improved the existing Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient (DDPG) reinforcement learning algorithm and developed and applied a set of intelligent control frameworks of DDPG-DC combined with the delay compensation strategy. By incorporating an experience replay mechanism with delay compensation strategies, the system demonstrates enhanced dynamic response and superior disturbance rejection capabilities. Industrial field trials confirm a 24% reduction in root mean square error in the width direction of the strip (RMSE from 3.94 to 3.01 I-units) under the same rolling conditions. This advancement optimizes continuous production of thin silicon steel (thickness ≤ 0.5 mm) while maintaining flatness quality during rapid speed transitions, achieving a critical breakthrough for high-precision rolling applications.

AI.tldr: 本研究改进了深度确定性策略梯度（DDPG）强化学习算法，结合延迟补偿策略，提出了一种智能控制框架DDPG-DC，显著提升了冷轧过程中的平坦度控制性能，工业试验显示宽度方向均方根误差降低24%。
AI.research_question: 如何解决冷轧过程中由于多变量交互、强耦合效应、非线性动态和时滞特性导致的平坦度控制难题？
AI.motivation: 传统静态模型控制方法在非稳态轧制阶段（如加减速、飞剪控制等）表现不佳，参数突变导致精度和鲁棒性不足。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于深度确定性策略梯度（DDPG）强化学习算法，结合延迟补偿策略。
AI.method: 改进DDPG算法，开发DDPG-DC智能控制框架，结合经验回放机制与延迟补偿策略。
AI.findings: 工业试验中，相同轧制条件下带钢宽度方向均方根误差降低24%（从3.94降至3.01 I-units）。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一种结合延迟补偿的DDPG改进算法，为复杂工业控制问题提供了新的理论框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 优化了薄硅钢（厚度≤0.5 mm）的连续生产，在快速速度转换中保持平坦度质量，为高精度轧制应用提供了关键技术突破。

title: Discovery of the Law of Autocatalytic Inevitability: A New Natural Law Governing Network Self-Organization
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Discovery of the Law of Autocatalytic Inevitability: A New Natural Law Governing Network Self-Organization
detail.abstract:
This paper introduces the Law of Autocatalytic Inevitability (N(l) = k^l), a newly discovered natural law that governs the deterministic emergence of trust-free peer-to-peer networks. Unlike traditional behavioral models, this law demonstrates that under specific architectural conditions—namely, structural harm prevention, empathic connection inheritance, and Dunbar-limited participation—global decentralized cooperation is mathematically inevitable.

The framework is practically implemented through DSI Exodus 2.0, which replaces trust verification with structural irrelevance and initiates the emergence of Economy 3.0—a post-monetary, zero-transaction-cost economic paradigm. The paper outlines the theoretical foundations, provides a mathematical proof, discusses engineering implications, and presents empirical precedents. This discovery redefines social coordination: cooperation becomes inevitable once the structural law is activated.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新的自然法则——自催化必然性定律（N(l) = k^l），该定律揭示了在特定架构条件下，全球去中心化合作的数学必然性。通过DSI Exodus 2.0框架的实际应用，实现了无信任验证的经济3.0范式。

AI.motivation: 传统行为模型无法解释去中心化合作的必然性，本文旨在填补这一理论空白。
AI.theoretical_framework: 自催化必然性定律（N(l) = k^l）、结构性伤害预防、共情连接继承、邓巴数限制参与。
AI.method: 理论推导、数学证明、工程实现（DSI Exodus 2.0框架）及实证案例分析。
AI.findings: 在特定架构条件下，去中心化合作是数学上必然的，且可实现无信任验证的经济3.0范式。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了自催化必然性定律，重新定义了社会协调的理论基础。
AI.practical_contributions: 通过DSI Exodus 2.0框架实现了零交易成本的经济3.0范式，为去中心化网络提供了工程实践指导。

title: The Relationship between ESG Performance and Firm Financial Performance: An Inverted U-Shaped Relationship
affiliations: Shanghai Zhongqiao Vocational and Technical University and Shangrao Normal University

detail.title: The Relationship between ESG Performance and Firm Financial Performance: An Inverted U-Shaped Relationship
detail.abstract: Based on the data of Chinese listed companies from 2009 to 2022, this study examines the relationship between Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) and firm financial performance. It is found that there is an inverted U-shaped relationship between ESG and firm financial performance. Moreover, in non-political contexts (i.e., enterprises led by CEOs without political connections and non-state-owned enterprises), both the synergistic effect when ESG levels are low and the crowding-out effect when ESG levels are high are more significant.

AI.tldr: 本研究基于2009年至2022年中国上市公司数据，探讨了ESG与企业财务绩效之间的关系，发现两者呈倒U型关系，且在非政治背景下（如无政治关联的CEO领导的企业和非国有企业）更为显著。

AI.motivation: 探讨ESG对企业财务绩效的影响，特别是在不同政治背景下的差异。
AI.theoretical_framework: ESG理论、企业财务绩效理论、政治关联理论。
AI.method: 基于2009-2022年中国上市公司数据的实证分析。

detail.title: Government's Information Disclosure Considering Demand Uncertainty and Signal Inference
detail.abstract: Government subsidies are pivotal in shaping supply chain dynamics, yet their interplay with disclosing demand information publicly and market competition remains underexplored. This study examines how subsidies, coupled with information asymmetry between incumbent firms and new entrants, influence social welfare, firm profitability, and strategic government decisions. Through a game-theoretical model of two competing firms-an informed incumbent and an uninformed entrant-we analyze two scenarios: one where the government discloses demand information and the other one where it withholds information, prompting the entrant to infer demand from subsidy signals. Key findings reveal that entrants' ability to infer demand from subsidies correlates positively with subsidy levels, though this sensitivity diminishes under information disclosure when competition is low. Disclosure increases subsidies and enhances market promotion flexibility, yet disproportionately benefits incumbents, who leverage reduced information asymmetry, while entrants face diminished incentives to expand sales amid intensified competition. The study underscores that optimal welfare outcomes emerge under moderate competition, balancing equitable market access and efficiency. These insights highlight the critical trade-offs governments face in designing subsidy policies, emphasizing that strategic information disclosure and competition regulation are essential to maximize societal benefits while mitigating market distortions.

detail.title: Dynamic Simulation of Carbon Emission Reduction Benefits in Prefabricated Building Supply Chain: A Cluster Perspective
detail.abstract: The cluster-oriented development of prefabricated buildings (PBs) has emerged as a key driver promoting the low-carbon economic transition of China’s construction industry. However, few studies have explored the long-term and dynamic changes in the carbon emission reduction economic benefits (CEREB) for different stakeholders within the prefabricated building supply chain (PBSC) under varying clustering levels. This study combines system dynamics (SD) modeling with industrial cluster theory to simulate the CEREB within PBSC, and the model's validity is verified through a case study of a PBs project. The results demonstrate that: (1) The CEREB of prefabricated component factories (CF) follows an inverted U-shape as clustering increases, with excessive clustering leading to higher carbon emissions; (2) The CEREB of transportation companies (TC) under high clustering is 2.76 times greater than under medium clustering; (3) The CEREB of project contractors (PC) is highest under medium clustering with low carbon subsidies, and is 2.73 times higher than the low clustering. Accordingly, differentiated emission reduction strategies are proposed for varying clustering scenarios, offering practical implications for PBSC stakeholders and policymakers in designing effective mitigation policies.

keywords.keywords: Traffic Flow PredictionSpatio-Temporal Graph ConvolutionalNetworksGraph TransformerIntelligent Transportation System

detail.abstract: Time-evolving traffic flow forecasting are playing a vital role in intelligent transportation systems and smart cities. However, the dynamic traffic flow forecasting is a highly nonlinear problem with complex temporal-spatial dependencies. Although the existing methods has provided great contributions to mine the temporal-spatial patterns in the complex traffic networks, they fail to encode the globally temporal-spatial patterns and are prone to overfit on the pre-defined geographical correlations, and thus hinder the model's robustness on the complex traffic environment. To tackle this issue, in this work, we proposed a multi-grained temporal-spatial graph learning framework to adaptively augment the globally temporal-spatial patterns obtained from a crafted graph transformer encoder with the local patterns from the graph convolution by a crafted gated fusion unit with residual connection techniques. Under these circumstances, our proposed model can mine the hidden global temporal-spatial relations between each monitor stations and balance the relative importance of local and global temporal-spatial patterns. Experiment results demonstrate the strong representation capability of our proposed method and our model consistently outperforms other strong baselines on various real-world traffic networks.

detail.title: The Impact of AI on Global GDP Comparative Analysis Between Countries
detail.abstract: The development of artificial intelligence (AI) technology globally has had a significant impact on world economic growth. AI plays a role in driving production efficiency, service innovation, and digital transformation in various sectors of the economy, which ultimately affects the increase in global Gross Domestic Product (GDP). However, the benefits of AI advancements are not evenly distributed between countries. Developed countries such as the United States, China, and European countries tend to gain greater economic benefits because they have strong digital infrastructure, high research and development investments, and skilled human resources. In contrast, many developing countries still face challenges in accessing and implementing AI optimally, which has widened the global economic growth gap. This study aims to examine how AI affects global GDP unevenly between countries and analyze the factors that cause this inequality. With a descriptive-qualitative approach based on literature studies, this study highlights the need for strategic policies, international collaboration, and technological capacity building in developing countries so that the benefits of AI can be felt more fairly and equitably at the global level.

detail.title: Evaluating the effectiveness of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs) in India
detail.abstract: This dissertation examines in detail the effectiveness of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs), focusing specifically on recent issuances by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), totalling USD 600 million. The central aim is to ascertain whether these financial instruments are genuinely attracting fresh capital for environmentally beneficial projects and, more importantly, if they are delivering tangible environmental improvements. Through a meticulous review of official bond frameworks and pertinent government reports, this study addresses several pivotal questions: Who are the primary investors-are they predominantly institutional, retail, or foreign entities? How precisely are the proceeds being allocated across various eligible green initiatives, such as solar energy, sustainable building practices, or even cleaner aviation fuels? Furthermore, what measurable environmental and social outcomes, if any, can be attributed to these investments? The thesis also critically examines the concept of 'additionality' within the context of public finance, exploring whether SGrBs truly introduce new funding streams or merely re-label existing governmental expenditures on green projects. Based on these insights, the study culminates in a series of policy recommendations designed to bolster transparency, stimulate broader investor engagement, and facilitate the seamless integration of a robust green taxonomy into India's evolving sustainable finance landscape. Ultimately, this research endeavours to enrich the academic discourse by offering a nuanced perspective on the opportunities and inherent challenges associated with leveraging sovereign debt instruments to advance sustainable development in dynamic emerging economies.

detail.abstract: Energy finance is an interdisciplinary, rapidly evolving field integrating finance, economics, and energy systems to address complex challenges in market dynamics, sustainability, and policy-making amidst global energy transitions to net zero. Recent advances in artificial intelligence have reshaped energy finance research and practice, but no prior study has systematically examined how these methods have been applied across the field or what value they have brought. This paper provides a comprehensive review of approximately 700 academic studies published over the past five years, analyzing the diffusion and contribution of AI techniques across the six established thematic areas proposed by Zhang et al. (2018). While machine learning models are increasingly adopted, especially in forecasting applications, and often outperform classical econometric approaches in terms of accuracy, their use remains uneven. In some cases, methodological choices are clearly adapted to the structure of the data and the objective of the study, while in others, the implementation of complex ML algorithms lacks contextual justification or interpretability. More importantly, the review highlights a major gap, namely recent approaches such as explainable AI and causal machine learning are almost entirely absent, despite their potential to enhance transparency, support causal inference, and inform energy-related financial decisions. By identifying where AI has already contributed, where it remains underused, and how it could be better integrated, the paper offers a structured and forward-looking perspective on the evolving relationship between artificial intelligence and energy finance.

detail.title: Predicting the Daily Return Direction of the Stock Market Using Machine Learning and Deep Learning Algorithms
detail.abstract: This paper mainly focuses on comparing the predictive performance of logistic regression, machine learning models (random forests (RF), support vector machines (SVM)) and deep learning models (convolutional neural networks (CNN) models) in predicting stock direction. Specifically, the research data is selected from the daily closing price of the iShares MSCI Emerging Markets ETF (EEM). Furthermore, 16 explanatory variables are used as input data to predict the direction of the closing price of the EEM on the next trading day. In order to better analyze the performance of the models, several evaluation methods are adopted, including accuracy (ACC), area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC), the probability of an upward prediction, and confusion matrix. By establishing a simple investment strategy. this paper also examined the profitability of the models in the real trading market. The result demonstrates that logistic regression model, which is limited by its linear structure, performs poorly in terms of model accuracy and profitability. RF, SVM and CNN models demonstrate strong predictive ability in forecasting, among which, SVM are better at capturing uptrends in the stock market, while RF and CNN are more suitable for use in markets with long-term losses.

title: History Absolves the FTC: A Defense of the Rule on Non-Competes and Functional Non-Competes
affiliations: Temple University Beasley School of Law

detail.title: History Absolves the FTC: A Defense of the Rule on Non-Competes and Functional Non-Competes

declarations.funderStatement: The author is a senior fellow with the Student Borrower Protection Center.

detail.abstract:
The Federal Trade Commission’s (FTC’s) Non-Compete Clause Rule (the “Rule”), finalized in spring 2024, effectively bans all non-compete clauses and “functional” non-compete clauses based on their anti-competitive effects on labor markets. The FTC issued the Rule under its Unfair Methods of Competition (UMC) authority under Section 5 of the FTC Act. Employers and their trade groups immediately filed legal challenges, and the Rule was subsequently enjoined by two federal judges but upheld by a third. The injunctions were generally based on disagreement with the FTC’s ability to issue substantive rules and on the major questions doctrine. 

This blog post offers a historical overview of FTC actions to argue that the injunctions were improper, especially with regard to the Rule’s prohibition of “functional” non-competes that operate to prohibit or penalize workers for obtaining other work. This history belies opponents’ arguments that the Rule implicates the major questions doctrine and that the FTC is only now beginning to exercise its UMC authority against anticompetitive practices affecting workers.

AI.tldr: 本文分析了FTC 2024年颁布的《非竞争条款规则》，探讨其禁止非竞争条款及功能性非竞争条款的法律依据及争议，并反驳了反对者的论点。
AI.research_question: FTC颁布的《非竞争条款规则》是否合法？其禁止功能性非竞争条款的依据是否充分？
AI.motivation: 探讨FTC新规的法律依据及其对劳动力市场竞争的影响，反驳反对者的法律挑战。
AI.theoretical_framework: 主要基于FTC的《不公平竞争方法》（UMC）权限及《FTC法案》第5条。
AI.method: 通过历史回顾分析FTC的行动，反驳反对者的法律论点。
AI.findings: FTC的行动历史表明其有权禁止功能性非竞争条款，反对者的论点缺乏依据。
AI.theory_contributions: 为FTC行使UMC权限提供了历史和法律支持。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者和法律实践者提供了关于非竞争条款禁令的合法性分析。

title: Rethinking the Contract-Failure Theory
affiliations: University of Virginia (UVA) School of Law

detail.title: Rethinking the Contract-Failure Theory
detail.abstract:
The contract-failure theory posits that the nonprofit form can be an indicator of high product quality, because the nondistribution constraint reduces the nonprofit manager’s financial benefits from cheating. This would give nonprofits an advantage over for-profit firms when consumers cannot determine product quality, and thus explains nonprofits’ existence.

This paper finds that nonprofits are not generally more trustworthy. It is methodologically wrong to compare the nonprofit and for-profit managers’ personal benefits from cheating to one another. Instead, both nonprofit and for-profit managers will act to maximize their respective utility, seeking either higher income and/or more leisure. Since providing low-quality products leads to both less effort and a lower cost, both nonprofits and for-profit firms will cheat. Further, providers cannot overcharge because there are no informational asymmetries about product price. The market price in “contract failure” situations will drop, forcing both nonprofits and for-profit firms to offer only the lowest quality product. Shifting to nonprofit purposes requires nonprofits to allocate part of their resources through giving, which makes some of their transactions trustworthy. However, consumers usually cannot identify trustworthy transactions.

Not only will adopting the nonprofit form not make an untrustworthy provider trustworthy, but trustworthy providers are also not necessarily more likely than untrustworthy ones to take that form because it costs untrustworthy-inefficient providers even less to do so. The nonprofit form thus cannot be an effective signal of high quality.

Even if nonprofits were more trustworthy, this cannot explain why nonprofits exist. It is the supply side, which only partly overlaps the “contract failure” situations, that drives the nonprofit sector. The existence of other informational-asymmetries-relieving mechanisms also reduces consumers’ demand for the nonprofit form.

        In debunking the contract-failure theory, this paper will be useful for scholars examining nonprofits’ behavior and the justification for the nonprofit sector.

AI.tldr: 本文驳斥了合同失败理论，认为非营利组织并不普遍更值得信赖，且非营利形式不能有效作为高质量的信号。此外，非营利组织的存在并非由需求侧驱动，而是供给侧因素。

detail.title: Information Property
detail.abstract: Information Property is a textbook for a survey course in intellectual property law that emphasizes conceptual clarity and the structural unity of IP law. It provides a rigorous, systematic treatment of the way in which every IP field is characterized by its own distinctive versions of the same common concerns: the subject matter it protects, the source of ownership over particular material, the procedures required to secure protection, the zone of similarity around the plaintiff's information that it protects, the type of prohibited conduct that constitutes infringement, the conduct that can lead to secondary liability, and its significant defenses. In addition to the standard subfields—patent, copyright, and trademark—Information Property includes comparative coverage of trade secret, false advertising, right of publicity, and design patent. Extensive illustrations make the issues visually apparent, and numerous problems enable readers and students to deepen their understanding by applying important IP concepts to solve real-world problems. Extensively student-tested, Intellectual Property has been used for over a decade.

AI.tldr: 这是一本关于知识产权法的教科书，强调概念清晰和知识产权法的结构统一性，涵盖专利、版权、商标等多个子领域，并通过案例和问题帮助读者深入理解。

title: Exploring the Influence of Generative AI on Consumer Experiences and Behavioral Responses: A Systematic Literature Review and Future Research Agenda

detail.title: Exploring the Influence of Generative AI on Consumer Experiences and Behavioral Responses: A Systematic Literature Review and Future Research Agenda
detail.abstract: Generative Artificial Intelligence (Gen AI) has quickly become a transformative force in marketing, greatly shaping consumer experiences and behavioral responses. Despite its increasing importance, scholarly investigation of this area remains limited. To address this gap, the author systematically reviewed 139 research articles from Scopus and other peer-reviewed sources, selected using specific keywords and strict inclusion and exclusion criteria. This study uses the SPAR-4-SLR Protocol, and the Theory-Context-Construct-Methods (TCCM) framework proposed by Paul and Rosado-Serrano (2019) to analyze the literature. A bibliometric analysis with Bibliometrix-R identifies leading contributors, key journals, influential countries, and thematic trends in the field. The review details the theoretical foundations, contextual settings (countries and industries), constructs (key variables), and methodological approaches employed in studies on the impact of Gen AI since its mainstream debut in November 2022. It also provides a comprehensive conceptual framework that illustrates the relationships among independent, mediating, moderating, and dependent variables, derived from existing literature. This model provides a new perspective and advances the theoretical understanding of Gen AI's role in consumer behavior research. Practical implications are also discussed for marketing professionals aiming to leverage Gen AI to enhance customer engagement. Ultimately, the review highlights promising directions for future research, serving as a foundational resource for academics and practitioners seeking to explore and contribute to this emerging field.

AI.tldr: 本文通过系统综述139篇研究文献，使用SPAR-4-SLR协议和TCCM框架，分析了生成式人工智能（Gen AI）在营销中的影响，提出了一个概念框架，并探讨了未来研究方向。

AI.motivation: 尽管Gen AI在营销中的重要性日益增加，但学术研究仍有限，本文旨在填补这一空白。

AI.method: 系统综述139篇文献，结合文献计量分析（Bibliometrix-R）和TCCM框架。
AI.findings: 提出了Gen AI在消费者行为研究中的理论模型，并识别了关键变量和关系。
AI.theory_contributions: 通过概念框架推进了对Gen AI在消费者行为中作用的理论理解。
AI.practical_contributions: 为营销从业者提供了利用Gen AI提升客户参与度的实践建议。

detail.abstract: The tentative name of the token is “MCN8™” and it will be a multi-chain token. This token combines elements of a meme-token and a Utility-token. title: Research on Multi-Objective Optimization Control of Intelligent Driving Hybrid Tractor Under Dynamic Path Changes and Dynamic Load Conditions
affiliations: Henan University of Science and Technology, Henan University of Science and Technology, affiliation not provided to SSRN, Henan University of Science and Technology, Henan University of Science and Technology and Henan University of Science and Technology

detail.title: Research on Multi-Objective Optimization Control of Intelligent Driving Hybrid Tractor Under Dynamic Path Changes and Dynamic Load Conditions
detail.abstract: To simultaneously improve tracking performance and economy of intelligent driving hybrid tractor under dynamic path changes and dynamic load conditions, a multi-objective optimization control strategy (MOOCS) was proposed, which integrated path tracking strategy and energy management strategy. Firstly, to enhance tracking performance under dynamic path changes, a model predictive control (MPC) path tracking strategy with error compensation (MPC-EC) was designed based on MPC and fuzzy principle, which makes the minimum lateral deviation and heading angle deviation as the target. Secondly, to improve economy under dynamic load conditions, an energy management strategy based on deep deterministic policy gradients (EMS-DDPG) was designed. which minimizes equivalent fuel consumption and state of charge difference (between actual and reference) as the target. Finally, based on the expected acceleration of the MPC-EC, the interaction between MPC-EC and EMS-DDPG was realized, and then a MOOCS was formed. The MPC path tracking and power following energy management strategy was adopted as a comparison strategy. The results showed that the MOOCS could effectively reduce the tractor's path tracking deviation while improving its economy when compared with the comparison strategy under dynamic path changes and dynamic load conditions. The absolute average error of the lateral deviation was reduced by 38.46%, the absolute average error of the heading angle deviation was reduced by 11.11%, and the equivalent fuel consumption was reduced by 11.64%, compared with the comparison strategy.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种多目标优化控制策略（MOOCS），结合路径跟踪和能量管理，显著提升了智能驾驶混合动力拖拉机在动态路径变化和动态负载条件下的跟踪性能和经济性。
AI.research_question: 如何在动态路径变化和动态负载条件下同时提升智能驾驶混合动力拖拉机的跟踪性能和经济性？
AI.motivation: 智能驾驶混合动力拖拉机在复杂工况下的性能和经济性优化需求迫切，现有策略难以兼顾二者。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于模型预测控制（MPC）和模糊原理的路径跟踪策略（MPC-EC），以及基于深度确定性策略梯度（DDPG）的能量管理策略（EMS-DDPG）。
AI.method: 设计MPC-EC策略优化路径跟踪，设计EMS-DDPG策略优化能量管理，并通过预期加速度实现两者交互，形成MOOCS。
AI.findings: MOOCS显著优于对比策略，横向偏差绝对平均误差减少38.46%，航向角偏差绝对平均误差减少11.11%，等效燃油消耗减少11.64%。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一种结合MPC和DDPG的多目标优化控制框架，为复杂工况下的智能驾驶系统提供了新思路。
AI.practical_contributions: MOOCS在实际应用中可显著提升拖拉机的跟踪精度和燃油经济性，具有较高的工程价值。

title: Employee Ownership and Promotive Voice: The Roles of Psychological Ownership and Perceived Alignment of Interests

detail.title: Employee Ownership and Promotive Voice: The Roles of Psychological Ownership and Perceived Alignment of Interests

publicationDetails.journalName: IZA Institute of Labor Economics Discussion Paper Series

detail.abstract: Using a National Bureau of Economic Research dataset of employees of 14 United States companies with shared capitalism practices, we compare two prominent explanations of employee ownerships influence on pro-organizational behaviorspsychological ownership and alignment of financial interestsby testing the effects of Employee Stock Ownership Plans (ESOPs) and current profit sharing on promotive voice. We conducted a path-analysis of a moderated multiple-mediation regression model using the PROCESS macro. Our sample included 16,557 participants. We find that psychological ownership partially transmits the effects of ESOP participation and current profit sharing on promotive voice. Employee decision influence strengthens the relationship between ESOP participation and psychological ownership. Perceived alignment of interests does not mediate the relationships between employee ownership and promotive voice.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过分析美国14家公司的员工数据，比较了心理所有权和财务利益对齐对员工持股计划（ESOPs）和当前利润分享对促进性建言行为的影响。研究发现心理所有权部分中介了这种关系，而感知利益对齐未起到中介作用。
AI.research_question: 员工持股计划（ESOPs）和当前利润分享如何通过心理所有权和财务利益对齐影响员工的促进性建言行为？
AI.motivation: 探讨员工持股计划对员工行为的两种主要解释（心理所有权和财务利益对齐）的实际影响，以验证哪种理论更具解释力。
AI.theoretical_framework: 心理所有权理论和财务利益对齐理论。

title: Mapping the Multiplex Structure of Global Liner Shipping: Connectivity Profiles and Competitive Positioning of Carriers
affiliations: Jiaxing University, affiliation not provided to SSRN and Dalian University of Technology

detail.title: Mapping the Multiplex Structure of Global Liner Shipping: Connectivity Profiles and Competitive Positioning of Carriers
detail.abstract: The global liner shipping system, a critical backbone of international trade, is shaped by decentralized service planning, with each carrier designing its own route network based on strategic and commercial priorities. However, increasing collaboration across routes has intensified competition and reduced service differentiation, highlighting the need to understand how distinct routing strategies influence network structures and emergent system performance. In this study, we examine the Multiplex Global Liner Shipping Network (mGLSN) by integrating detailed service route data from the world’s top 20 carriers, modeling each carrier as an independent layer. We introduce a novel role-to-role connectivity profile identification method to uncover the structural patterns of individual Carrier Shipping Networks (CSNs). Our analysis shows that while most carriers adopt hub-and-spoke configurations, their aggregation results in a Global Liner Shipping Network (GLSN) characterized by a mixed “core-of-hubs” and “clustered-periphery” topology. By clustering carriers based on their connectivity profiles, we identify distinct strategic groups that align with market positioning and performance outcomes: first-tier carriers dominate the global backbone, second-tier carriers enhance inter-regional connectivity, and smaller carriers operate as localized feeders. These differentiated network profiles underscore the strategic value of tailored network designs. By leveraging multiplex network modeling and role-based connectivity analysis, we provide new insights into how carrier-level strategies collectively shape the structure of the GLSN. Our findings offer managerial implications for service differentiation and competitive positioning within the global liner shipping industry, and contribute empirical evidence of self-organizing principles in real-world complex systems, illuminating the multifaceted nature of global network formation.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过整合全球前20大航运公司的详细航线数据，构建了多层次的全球班轮航运网络（mGLSN），并提出了一种新的角色间连接性分析方法，揭示了不同航运公司的网络结构策略及其对整体网络性能的影响。研究发现，航运公司分为三个战略群体，分别主导全球主干、增强区域间连接或作为本地支线运营，为航运业的差异化竞争提供了管理启示。
AI.research_question: 不同的航线策略如何影响全球班轮航运网络的结构和性能？
AI.motivation: 随着航运公司间合作的增加，竞争加剧且服务差异化减少，需要理解不同航线策略对网络结构和系统性能的影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 多路复用网络模型、角色间连接性分析、自组织复杂系统理论。
AI.method: 整合全球前20大航运公司的航线数据，构建mGLSN模型，采用角色间连接性分析方法识别结构模式。
AI.findings: 航运公司分为三个战略群体：主导全球主干的第一梯队、增强区域间连接的第二梯队和本地支线运营的小型公司，整体网络呈现“核心-外围”混合拓扑。
AI.theory_contributions: 为复杂系统中的自组织原则提供了实证证据，揭示了全球网络形成的多面性。
AI.practical_contributions: 为航运公司提供了差异化网络设计和竞争定位的管理启示。

title: Non-Linear Factor Investing in the Era of Machine Learning
affiliations: Victoria University of Wellington

detail.title: Non-Linear Factor Investing in the Era of Machine Learning
detail.abstract: We apply genetic programming to systematically generate thousands of non-linear factor strategies and uncover various stock market anomalies that remain robust out-of-sample, even under multiple hypothesis testing. These non-linear strategies outperform raw anomalies by maintaining consistent profitability after controlling for arbitrage constraints (excluding microcaps), trading costs, recent data (post-2020), and risk adjustments; responding to Chen and Velikov (2023)'s critique of limited out-of-sample validity. Compared to Muller and Schmickler (2025)’s double-sorted portfolio and single-sorted portfolio using pairwise interactions, our non-linear anomaly portfolio delivers superior performance while remaining transparent, interpretable, and low-turnover; key advantages over conventional machine learning approaches. Moreover, we develop an interpretable non-linear four- or five-factor model that consistently outperforms established benchmarks in both right-hand-side and left-hand-side asset pricing tests. Our non-linear factor models consist primarily of accounting-based anomalies, which enhances their viability net of trading costs, owing to the lower turnover and higher investment capacity associated with accounting variables.

AI.tldr: 本文通过遗传编程生成非线性因子策略，发现多种稳健的股票市场异常现象，并在样本外测试中表现优异。这些策略在控制套利限制、交易成本、近期数据和风险调整后仍保持盈利，优于传统方法。
AI.research_question: 如何通过遗传编程生成非线性因子策略，并验证其在股票市场中的稳健性和优越性？

AI.theoretical_framework: 遗传编程、非线性因子模型、股票市场异常现象。
AI.method: 应用遗传编程生成非线性因子策略，并进行样本外测试，控制套利限制、交易成本、近期数据和风险调整。

title: When Data Redefines Growth: New Rules for Threshold, Polarization and Equilibrium
affiliations: affiliation not provided to SSRN and affiliation not provided to SSRN

detail.title: When Data Redefines Growth: New Rules for Threshold, Polarization and Equilibrium
detail.abstract: This study explores the asymmetric restructuring mechanism of data elements on economic growth and income distribution in the digital era, by incorporating data into an extended CES production function within a dynamic general equilibrium framework. It estimates for the first time that the dynamic elasticity of substitution between data and physical capital is 0.568, with a synergistic equilibrium at their ratio of 1.76. The study further reveals a dual-threshold effect: crossing data density levels of 0.038 and 0.395 triggers a network effect (0.175), shifting marginal returns from suppression to a 56.8% growth surge. Moreover, data-driven technological change, biased toward skilled labor, intensifies income inequality. High-skilled workers gain an additional return of 2.851% due to the synergy between data and skills. The combination of skill premiums and regional differences forms the core mechanism of the digital divide. The results provide theoretical and governance insights for global digital policy.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过将数据纳入扩展的CES生产函数，在动态一般均衡框架下探讨了数据要素对经济增长和收入分配的非对称重构机制。研究发现数据与物质资本的动态替代弹性为0.568，协同均衡比例为1.76。此外，数据密度跨越0.038和0.395时触发网络效应（0.175），边际回报从抑制转为56.8%的增长。数据驱动的技术变革偏向高技能劳动力，加剧收入不平等。高技能工人因数据与技能的协同效应获得额外2.851%的回报。技能溢价和区域差异构成数字鸿沟的核心机制。
AI.research_question: 数据要素在数字时代如何非对称地重构经济增长和收入分配？
AI.motivation: 数字时代数据要素的重要性日益凸显，但其对经济和收入分配的具体影响机制尚不明确。
AI.theoretical_framework: 扩展的CES生产函数和动态一般均衡框架。
AI.method: 通过动态一般均衡模型估计数据与物质资本的替代弹性及协同效应。
AI.findings: 数据与物质资本的动态替代弹性为0.568，协同均衡比例为1.76；数据密度跨越阈值触发网络效应，边际回报显著增长；数据驱动的技术变革加剧收入不平等。
AI.theory_contributions: 首次量化数据与物质资本的动态替代关系，揭示数据密度阈值效应及其对经济增长的促进作用。
AI.practical_contributions: 为全球数字政策提供理论依据和治理建议，特别是针对数字鸿沟和收入不平等的政策设计。

detail.title: Firm Digital Transformation and Capital Market Pricing: Technology Uncertainty, Risk Premium, and Investor Sentiment
detail.abstract: Digital transformation not only improves corporate operation efficiency and governance, but also generates substantial spillover effect in the capital market. This paper applies the Fama-French Five-Factor Model to investigate the impact of firm digital transformation on excess returns in the stock market by using the Chinese A-share listed company data from 2011 to 2023. The results show that firms with higher level of digital transformation can obtain greater excess returns in the stock market. This excess return comes from the uncertainties brought by R&D investment due to digital transformation, which has provided the market with a certain level of risk premium. This premium not only arises from improvements in the fundamental aspects of the firm, but is also driven by investor sentiment and expectations. Firms with higher level of digitalization are able to effectively transfer R&D capitalization to stable intangible assets by effectively reducing technology uncertainty, which eventually improves  profitability.

title: Bridge Influence Line Identification by Load-Response Spatiotemporal Synchronization and Kernel Density Estimation-Based Statistical Analysis Under Long-Term Monitoring

detail.title: Bridge Influence Line Identification by Load-Response Spatiotemporal Synchronization and Kernel Density Estimation-Based Statistical Analysis Under Long-Term Monitoring
detail.abstract: The bridge influence line (BIL) is a critical bridge static performance indicator. To enable accurate and robust identification of BIL under long-term monitoring scenario, this study proposes an integrated framework that combines influence line identification under asynchronous data and unknown train parameters with statistical analysis of long-term monitoring data. Firstly, a real-time train parameter identification method is developed based on wheel detection sensor signal to estimate critical train parameters. Secondly, a Bayesian optimization-based load-response spatiotemporal synchronization approach is developed to align train load with bridge response by optimizing a hybrid objective function composed of three physical criteria. This process simultaneously optimizes the train entry time and the regularization parameter, improving the accuracy and efficiency of BIL identification. Finally, a kernel density estimation-based statistical method is proposed to extract a representative long-term BIL that is robust to measurement noise and operational variability. Long-term SHM data collected from a steel truss railway bridge is used to validate the effectiveness of the proposed method. Results show that across different train types, the maximum overall relative error of identified BILs remains below 10%, and the peak relative error remains below 1%. Parameter analysis reveals that under current operating conditions, axle load errors have little influence on the identification accuracy. Furthermore, these results confirm the reliability and robustness of the proposed framework, demonstrating its potential for practical engineering applications.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种结合异步数据下影响线识别与长期监测数据统计分析的集成框架，用于准确识别桥梁静态性能指标（BIL）。通过实时列车参数识别、贝叶斯优化同步方法及核密度估计统计，验证了方法的有效性和鲁棒性。

AI.method: 1. 基于轮检测传感器信号的实时列车参数识别；2. 贝叶斯优化同步方法；3. 核密度估计提取代表性BIL。
AI.findings: 最大整体相对误差低于10%，峰值相对误差低于1%；轴载误差对识别精度影响小。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一种结合异步数据同步与统计分析的BIL识别框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 验证了方法在工程应用中的可靠性和鲁棒性。

title: Combining DeepForest and Segment Anything Model 2 for Oil Palm Crown Segmentation

detail.title: Combining DeepForest and Segment Anything Model 2 for Oil Palm Crown Segmentation
detail.abstract: The oil palm industry in Santander, Colombia, faces significant challenges in large-scale plantation management, particularly the early detection of bud rot disease caused by Phytophthora palmivora, which can devastate entire crops. Early identification of this disease can be achieved by detecting morphological changes in the crown structure of the palm trees. Although recent research has explored various deep-learningbased approaches for tree counting, detection, and crown classification, detailed crown segmentation to detect disease symptoms remains largely unexplored. In this study, we propose the first integration of DeepForest for oil palm tree detection and Segment Anything Model 2 (SAM2) for precise crown segmentation using drone imagery. The proposed method achieves a Dice coefficient of 92% and a Jaccard index of 85%, showing its effectiveness in accurately segmenting oil palm crowns and laying the basis for timely disease detection, carbon capture metrics, and optimized resource allocation.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种结合DeepForest和SAM2的方法，用于油棕树冠的精确分割，以早期检测病害，效果显著。

AI.motivation: 油棕产业面临病害早期检测的挑战，现有研究在树冠分割方面仍有不足。

AI.method: 使用DeepForest检测油棕树，SAM2进行树冠分割。

AI.theory_contributions: 首次将DeepForest与SAM2结合用于油棕树冠分割。
